title: Drawing, "Gardens of Bacchus", ca. 1730
medium: Black chalk, brush and black ink, wash, traces of stylus on thick white laid paper, lined
provenance: "X" (sold, Paris, Feb. 1898, for 1280 francs); Léon Decloux (sold, Paris, Hotel Drouot, Feb. 14-15, l898, no. 171, for 1280 francs; bought back by Decloux (H. Mireur, Dictionnaire des Ventes d'Art (Paris, 1912), 7, p. 481.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: In the center, and altar with symbols of the grape, with groups of figures at either side, is set in a landscape, framed by a triple hanging arch. Below, a double shell with a dog and a goat; arabesque framework composed of herms, masks, garlands and bat-wing ornamentation. (RPW '61).

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Gardens of Bacchus", ca. 1730.
ca. 1730. Black chalk, brush and black ink, wash, traces of stylus on thick white laid paper, lined. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-294.
